children.name: to not obey a rule or law
disobey
children.definition: to not obey a law or rule: không tuân theo
examples: Protesters disobeyed the law and blocked the city’s main roads.
Troops openly disobeyed orders, refusing to use force against their own people.

children.name: break a law
children.definition: break a rule/law to not do what a rule or law says you must do: phá luật
examples: Students who break the rules and smoke in school will be suspended.
I do not want my sons’ TV role models to be tough, cool guys, who break laws and kill people.

children.name: violate
children.definition: to disobey or do sth that is against a rule, agreement, principle etc: vi phạm
examples: This action violated the constitution and the Civil Rights Act.
Police have arrested twenty people, accused of violating a ban on demonstrations.

children.name: ignore
children.definition: disregard/ to pay no attention to a law, rule, or to what sb has told you to do, and behave as if it does not affect you. Disregard is more formal than ignore:bất chấp, coi thường
examples: Many cyclists ignore the law and ride around at night without lights.
I tell her to come home by 10 o'clock, but she just ignores me.
Marlow sometimes disregards the law, but his aim is always justice.
By disregarding speed limits and passing red lights, we somehow got to the airport in time.

children.name: contravene
children.definition: formal to break a particular written law, rule, or agreement: vi phạm
examples: The sale of untreated milk may contravene public health regulations.
If a licence holder contravenes any of these conditions, their licence will be withdrawn.
contravention[C or U noun]
a contravention of
Driving faster than the speed limit is a contravention of the Road Traffic Act.
The Security Council ruled that the country had acted in contravention of international law.

children.name: flout
children.definition: a rule/law etcto deliberately break a law or a rule, especially because you think it is unnecessary or stupid: coi thường ; không tuân thủ
examples: Many bar owners flout the laws on under-age drinking.
Thousands of people are killed on our roads every year, yet a majority of us insist on flouting speed limits.

children.name: get into trouble
children.definition: to get into a situation in which you are blamed or punished for doing something illegal: gặp rắc rối
examples: Logue got into trouble for drug violations.

children.name: get into trouble with
examples: When he was a teenager, Wayne got into a lot of trouble with the police.

children.name: break the law
children.definition: to do sth that is illegal: phạm luật
examples: ▪I didn’t realize that I was breaking the law.
▪ Hamer acknowledges that what he did was wrong, but denies breaking the law.
▪ Should journalists ever break the law in order to get a story?
▪ If you break the law, you must expect to be punished.
▪ You’re breaking the law if you drive without wearing a seat belt.
▪ In many cases, people who have been released from prison will break the law again.

children.name: turn to crime
children.definition: to begin a way of life that involves crime:trở thành tội phạm
examples: ▪He claims that when he could not find work, he was forced to turn to crime.
▪ Kramer said that he turned to crime in a bid to pay off his debts.

children.name: commit
examples: commit a crime/ offence/ burglary/ murder etc
[to do sth that is a crime, or that is a particular type of crime]
▪ Detectives believe that the crime was committed at around 7.30 pm.
▪ Most violent crimes are committed by young men under the age of 25.
▪ She later claimed that she did not realize she was committing an offense.
▪Brady committed a series of brutal murders.
▪ Women commit far fewer crimes than men.
▪ It now seems likely that Mason was sent to prison for an offence he never committed.

children.name: have a criminal record
children.definition: if sb has a criminal record, they have been found guilty of a crime in the past, and this information is officially recorded by the police or the courts:

children.name: có tiền án hình sự
examples: A background check confirmed that he had a criminal record.
Loman has a lengthy criminal record.

children.name: contravene
children.definition: if sth a company or government does contravenes a particular law, it breaks that law, especially unintentionally-used especially in legal or official contexts:

children.name: vi phạm luật, trái luật (không cố ý)
examples: Penalties for contravening the laws on food hygiene have been increased.
Any interference in one country’s domestic affairs by another country contravenes the UN charter.

children.name: break the rules
children.definition: to do sth that is not allowed by the rules of an organization, game etc: phá lệ, phá luật
examples: Any student caught breaking the school rules was immediately sent to the Principal.

children.name: break the rules on
examples: Athletes can be fined thousands of dollars for breaking the rules on steroid use.

children.name: infringe
children.definition: to break a law, especially one that protects someone’s rights: vi phạm, trái luật
examples: If a teacher makes copies of software for students, he or she is infringing copyright.
Arrangements for widow’s pensions infringed laws on equal pay and treatment.

children.name: infringement
children.definition: /ɪnˈfrɪndʒmənt/  an illegal action, especially one that breaks a law that protectssomeone’srights:
examples: vi phạm
infringement of : vi phạm của
▪ The new rule was regarded as an infringement of the free-speech rights of government employees.
▪ an infringement of Article 86 of the Treaty of Rome
infringementnoun[ C or U ]sự vi phạm; sự xâm phạm
an action that breaks a rule, law, etc
_copyright infringement
_Even minor infringementsofthe law will be severely punished.

children.name: violation
children.definition: /ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/  an action that breaks a law or agreement, especially one that has been agreed by several different countries - use this about a serious illegal action: xâm phạm
examples: violation of xâm phạm tới
▪ Any further fighting will be seen as a violation of the ceasefire agreement.
flagrant/blatant violation of something sự xâm phạm thô bạo tới cái gì
one that is done without any attempt to hide it
▪ The United Nations described the invasion as ‘a flagrant violation of international law’.
gross violation of something sự xâm phạm thô tục, nặng nề tới cái gì
a very serious violation
▪ The way they treat women there represents a gross violation of human rights.
in violation of something
▪ The UK government was found to be in violation of the European Convention.
violationnoun[ C or U ]sự vi phạm; sự bị vi phạm
an action that breaks or acts against something, especially a law, agreement, principle orsomething that should be treated with respect
_He claimed that the way he'd been treated was a gross violationofhis civil/constitutional/human rights.
_The takeover of the embassy constitutes a flagrant/blatant violationofinternational law.
_It was clear that they had not actedinviolationofthe rules.

children.name: breach
children.definition: /briːtʃ/  something that acompanyorgovernmentdoes that breaks a particular law, especially when they donotdo itintentionally:
examples: phạm phép
breach of phạm phép của
▪ This is a clear breach of the 1994 Trade Agreement.
breach of contract vi phạm hợp đồng
▪ Workers who have lost their jobs plan to sue the company for breach of contract.
be in breach of something vi phạm, phạm phép cái gì
▪ In future, six-monthly accounts will be required from those firms that are in breach of the rules.
breachnoun[ C ]BROKEN PROMISE/RULE sự vi phạm, sự phạm
an act of breaking a law, promise, agreement or relationship
_They felt that our discussions with other companies constituted a breach of/in our agreement.
_He was sued for breach of contract .
_There have been serious security breaches (= breaks in our security system) .

children.name: contravention
children.definition: /ˌkɒntrəˈvenʃənǁˌkɑːn-/  formal something a business, organization, or government does that breaks a particular law or part of an official agreement: sự vi phạm, làm trái
examples: contraventionnoun[ C or U ]sự vi phạm
_By accepting the money, she wasincontraventionofcompany regulations.

children.name: in contravention of something làm trái cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Many shops and bars stayed open, in contravention of the Sunday trading laws.

children.name: contravention of vi phạm tới
examples: ▪ It was a clear contravention of EU regulations.
